avcl.name: avcl

revisions.description: The initial revision of this MIB module.

avcl.organization: ADTX (Advanced Technology and Systems Co., Ltd.)
avcl.contactinfo: Customer Service Officer Postal: Yokohama Business Park East Tower 9F 134 Goudo-cho, Hodogaya-ku, Yokohama-shi, Kanagawa-ken 240-0005 Japan Tel: +81-45-334-0040 E-mail: cso@adtx.com
avcl.description: The MIB module for the ADTX Virtual Console for L Series.

avclVersion.name: avclVersion
avclVersion.description: The software version of AVC-L basing on the Daemon as the data gathered is based on it. eg. '4.0 (for AVC-L 4.0)'

avclOS.name: avclOS
avclOS.description: The Operating System of where the AVC-L Daemon resides. eg. 'Windows 2000 (Service Pack 3)'

avclHost.name: avclHost
avclHost.description: The IP address or hostname of the system where the AVC-L daemon resides. eg. '172.16.16.204'

avclNumOfDevices.name: avclNumOfDevices
avclNumOfDevices.description: The number of L devices that the AVC-L Daemon is currently connected. eg. 2

avclEventInfo.name: avclEventInfo
avclEventInfo.description: This object will show the most recently sent 'critical' event or trap. Events/Traps can be sent by the AVC-L Daemon if SNMP notification is enabled in the Daemon's configuration file. This file can be configured thru the AVC-L Client. Value can be one of the following phrases: 'xxx Serial Number: yyy ADTX ArrayMasStor IP zzz device not accessible.' - this means that the device is disconnected, accidental or otherwise, and needs to be reconnected. 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Array nn: sss ==> Exposed.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Array nn: sss ==> Invalidated Protected Space.' - where: nn - array number sss - any status other than either 'Exposed' or 'Invalidated Protected Space' This means that the array's status changed to fail. Contact support. 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Array nn Lun mm: sss ==> Data Lost.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Array nn Lun mm: sss ==> Exposed.' - where: nn - array number mm - lun number sss - any status other than either 'Data Lost' or 'Exposed' This means that the lun's status changed to fail. Contact support. 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Spare ll: sss ==> Failed.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Spare ll: sss ==> Offline.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Spare ll: sss ==> Missing.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Spare ll: sss ==> Blank.' - where: ll - spare number sss - any status other than either 'Failed', 'Offline', 'Missing', or 'Blank' This means that the spare's status changed to fail. Contact support. 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Disk kk: sss ==> Failed.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Disk kk: sss ==> Offline.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Disk kk: sss ==> Missing.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Disk kk: sss ==> Blank.' - where: kk - disk/hdd number sss - any status other than either 'Failed', 'Offline', 'Missing', or 'Blank' This means that the disk's status changed to fail. Contact support. 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Component jj: sss ==> Broken.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy IP zzz Component jj: sss ==> Not Available.' - where: jj - disk/hdd number sss - any status other than either 'Broken' or 'Not Available' This means that the component's status changed to fail. Contact support. 'xxx Serial Number: yyy (ArrayMasStor) IP zzz Instant Copy LU ii to LU hh: abnormally ended.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy (ArrayMasStor) IP zzz Instant Copy LU ii to LU hh: terminated due to power off.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy (ArrayMasStor) IP zzz Instant Copy LU ii to LU hh: source size greater than destination.' 'xxx Serial Number: yyy (ArrayMasStor) IP zzz Instant Copy LU ii to LU hh: actual source size is lesser than specified size.' - where: ii - source lun hh - target lun This means that the instant copy failed and the data on target lun may be corrupted. Contact support. where: xxx - 'avcdaemon' or 'AVC Monitor Daemon - WinNT' yyy - serial number of the device concerned, eg. 'S000023' zzz - the IP address of the device concerned, eg. '172.16.16.190' The above event values are only for the critical events. There are other events that are more for informational purposes only.

avclDeviceInformationTable.name: avclDeviceInformationTable
avclDeviceInformationTable.description: This group (table) provides information about the L devices that are currently connected to the AVC-L Daemon

avclDeviceIndex.name: avclDeviceIndex
avclDeviceIndex.description: The index number of the L Device pertaining to this table. eg. 1

avclDeviceIP.name: avclDeviceIP
avclDeviceIP.description: IP address of the specific L device queried eg. '172.16.16.190'

avclDeviceManufacturer.name: avclDeviceManufacturer
avclDeviceManufacturer.description: The device's manufacturer name from the Inquiry command info eg. 'ADTX'

avclDeviceProductName.name: avclDeviceProductName
avclDeviceProductName.description: The device's product name from the Inquiry command info eg. 'AXRR-L'

avclDeviceRevisionLevel.name: avclDeviceRevisionLevel
avclDeviceRevisionLevel.description: The revision level of the device controller's microcode/firmware from the Inquiry command info. eg. 'L25X'

avclDeviceSerialNumber.name: avclDeviceSerialNumber
avclDeviceSerialNumber.description: The device's serial number from the Inquiry command info. eg. 'S000023'

avclDeviceDate.name: avclDeviceDate
avclDeviceDate.description: The controller's system date of the L device. eg. 'Mar 7, 2003'

avclDeviceTime.name: avclDeviceTime
avclDeviceTime.description: The controller's system time of the L device, in 24-hr format. eg. '14:35'

avclDeviceAssignedSpare.name: avclDeviceAssignedSpare
avclDeviceAssignedSpare.description: The device's global spare assignment. Can be any of the ff.: - No Assigned Spare - (numerical value in string) eg. 'No Assigned Spare'

avclDeviceInitiatorMode.name: avclDeviceInitiatorMode
avclDeviceInitiatorMode.description: Shows if the device is in Initiator mode or not. Can be any of the ff.: - Enabled - Disabled eg. 'Disabled'

avclDeviceInstantCopyLicense.name: avclDeviceInstantCopyLicense
avclDeviceInstantCopyLicense.description: Shows the license description for device Instant Copy. Can be any of the ff.: - Permanent Instant Copy - Temporary Instant Copy (# of days remaining) - No License eg. 'No License'

avclDeviceMirroringLicense.name: avclDeviceMirroringLicense
avclDeviceMirroringLicense.description: Shows the license description for device Mirroring. Can be any of the ff.: - Permanent Mirroring - Temporary Mirroring (# of days remaining) - No License eg. 'Permanent Mirroring'

avclDeviceWWNInfoCount.name: avclDeviceWWNInfoCount
avclDeviceWWNInfoCount.description: The count/number of WWN Information present in the device. eg. 1

avclDeviceWWNInfo.name: avclDeviceWWNInfo
avclDeviceWWNInfo.description: All WWN Information present in the device. First Controller WWN Information to be returned is that of Primary Controller, followed by Secondary Controller, and so on. F/O (Fail Over) Mode can be either 'Independent WWN' or 'Fail Over On Primary WWN' e.g. '50:03:07:A8:0A:00:01:13, F/O Mode: Independent WWN; 50:03:07:A8:0A:00:00:23, ....; ......'

avclDeviceSurfaceSchedMode.name: avclDeviceSurfaceSchedMode
avclDeviceSurfaceSchedMode.description: The mode for the scheduled surface check. Can be one of the ff: Type: - No Surface Verify - Sequential Verify - Parity Check - Parity Re-Generation Frequency: - null or the value is the zero-length string - Now - Once A Day - Once A Week - Once A Month - Always e.g. 'Type: No Surface Verify; Frequency: ' or 'Type: Sequential Verify; Frequency: Once A Day'

avclDeviceSurfaceSchedTime.name: avclDeviceSurfaceSchedTime
avclDeviceSurfaceSchedTime.description: The time for the scheduled surface check. Can be any of the ff. description: - null or the value is the zero-length string if there is no surface check or if always surface check. - the time of the day if 'Once A Day' - the day of the week and the time if 'Once A Week' - the day of the month and the time if 'Once A Month eg. '14:15' if Once A Day, 'Wednesday, 14:15' if Once A Week, or '24, 14:15' if Once A Month

avclDeviceSurfaceVerifyDuration.name: avclDeviceSurfaceVerifyDuration
avclDeviceSurfaceVerifyDuration.description: The duration of the scheduled surface check, in minutes. eg. 30

avclDeviceICSourceLU.name: avclDeviceICSourceLU
avclDeviceICSourceLU.description: The number of the source LU of the IC (Instant Copy) operation. eg. 1

avclDeviceICTargetLU.name: avclDeviceICTargetLU
avclDeviceICTargetLU.description: The number of the target LU of the Instant Copy operation. eg. 2

avclDeviceICFlag.name: avclDeviceICFlag
avclDeviceICFlag.description: This Instant Copy flag/status can be one of the ff.: - Stopped - Started - Copy to External Device - Copy From External Device - Instant Copy In Progress - Failed Due to Error - Cancelling Instant Copy

avclDeviceICProgress.name: avclDeviceICProgress
avclDeviceICProgress.description: This will contain the progress of the instant copy operation, in percent. eg. 99

avclDeviceICPairWWN.name: avclDeviceICPairWWN
avclDeviceICPairWWN.description: The worldwide node of the instant copy pair. eg. '50:03:07:A8:0A:00:01:13'

avclDeviceRegHostCount.name: avclDeviceRegHostCount
avclDeviceRegHostCount.description: The count of all registered hosts present in the device. eg. 2

avclDeviceRegHosts.name: avclDeviceRegHosts
avclDeviceRegHosts.description: Information of all registered hosts present in the device. Information includes: - Host x WWN, i.e. 50:03:07:A8:0A:00:01:13 - L Port Number: 0 (for Fibre Channel Port 0) and 1 (for Fibre Channel Port 1) - Host x LU Conversion, i.e. LU 1 can be seen as LU 5 by this host and LU 3 as LU1. Show only valid LU conversions out of the possible 32 conversions.. e.g. '50:03:07:A8:0A:00:01:13, 0, LU1->LU5, LU3->LU1; 50:03:07:A8:0A:00:00:23, 0, LU0->LU2, LU1->LU4, LU5->LU6, ; ......'

avclDeviceLuToMirrorCount.name: avclDeviceLuToMirrorCount
avclDeviceLuToMirrorCount.description: The count of all LUs to mirror. eg. 3

avclDeviceLunsToMirror.name: avclDeviceLunsToMirror
avclDeviceLunsToMirror.description: Information of all Luns to mirror. Includes: - Source Lun - Target Lun - L Port Number: 0 (for FC port 0) or 1 (for FC port 1) - Target WWN e.g. 'LU1, LU3, 0, 50:03:07:A8:0A:00:01:13; LU2, LU4, 1, 50:03:07:A8:0A:00:00:23; ......'

avclDeviceRaidGrpCount.name: avclDeviceRaidGrpCount
avclDeviceRaidGrpCount.description: The count of all RAID groups or arrays configured in any device. eg. 2

avclDeviceRaidGrpsState.name: avclDeviceRaidGrpsState
avclDeviceRaidGrpsState.description: Contains the state of each raid group present in the device. Can be one of the following: - Normal mode - Degraded mode - Reconstruction mode - Retry mode - System is starting up - System shutdown - System is not configured - System halt e.g. 'Array 1: Normal mode; Array 2: System halt; ......'

avclDeviceRaidGrpsDriveCount.name: avclDeviceRaidGrpsDriveCount
avclDeviceRaidGrpsDriveCount.description: The number of drives included in each raid group. e.g. 'Array 1: 5; Array 2: 3; ......'

avclDeviceRaidGrpsSize.name: avclDeviceRaidGrpsSize
avclDeviceRaidGrpsSize.description: Contains the size of each raid group. Size is in units of KB. e.g. 'Array 1: 645,620,224; Array 2: 300,000,000; ......'

avclDeviceRaidGrpsLuUnderSurfaceVerify.name: avclDeviceRaidGrpsLuUnderSurfaceVerify
avclDeviceRaidGrpsLuUnderSurfaceVerify.description: Contains the volume or LU number of all raid groups that is currently undergoing surface verify. Display only the raid groups that are undergoing this feature. If no raid group is undergoing surface verify, this value is the zero-length string. e.g. 'Array 1: LU3; Array 3: LU11; ......'

avclDeviceRaidGrpsSurfaceVerifyProgress.name: avclDeviceRaidGrpsSurfaceVerifyProgress
avclDeviceRaidGrpsSurfaceVerifyProgress.description: Contains the progress, in percentage, of all raid groups undergoing surface verify. Display only the raid groups that are undergoing this feature. If no raid group is undergoing surface verify, this value is the zero-length string. e.g. 'Array 1: 10; Array 3: 98; ......'

avclDeviceRaidGrpsInitReconProgress.name: avclDeviceRaidGrpsInitReconProgress
avclDeviceRaidGrpsInitReconProgress.description: Contains the progress, in percentage, of the initialization or reconstruction for all raid groups undergoing such process. e.g. 'Array 1: 17; Array 3: 85; ......'

avclDeviceRaidGrpsFreeSpace.name: avclDeviceRaidGrpsFreeSpace
avclDeviceRaidGrpsFreeSpace.description: Contains the total free space of all raid groups, in units of KB. e.g. 'Array 1: 5,000,000; Array 2: 0; ......'

avclDeviceSpareCount.name: avclDeviceSpareCount
avclDeviceSpareCount.description: The count of all spare drives in any device. eg. 1

avclDeviceSparesState.name: avclDeviceSparesState
avclDeviceSparesState.description: Contains the state of each spare drive present in the device. Can be one of the following: - On Line - Off Line - Not Configured - Working Properly - Failed or Not Attached - Under Reconstruction - Under Retry - Installed - Not Installed - Starting Up - Standing By - Power Supplied to the Drive - No Power Supplied - Drive is Reserved - Drive is Not Reserved e.g. 'Spare 1: Under Reconstruction; Spare 2: On Line; ......'

avclDeviceSparesRaidGrpNumber.name: avclDeviceSparesRaidGrpNumber
avclDeviceSparesRaidGrpNumber.description: Shows the raid group number to which the spare belongs. value is 'Global' if the spare is global or does not belong to any raid group. e.g. 'Spare 1: 3; Spare 2: Global; ......'

avclDeviceVolumeCount.name: avclDeviceVolumeCount
avclDeviceVolumeCount.description: The count of all volumes present in any device. Maximum number of volumes configurable is 32. Volume/LU number starts at 0. eg. 4

avclDeviceVolumesState.name: avclDeviceVolumesState
avclDeviceVolumesState.description: Contains the state of volumes present in the device. Can be one of the following: - Initialization Completed - Required - Initialization In Progress - LUN Failed - LUN Not Configured - Format Required - Format In Progress e.g. 'LU 1: LUN Failed; LU 2: Format Required; ......'

avclDeviceVolumesRaidGrpNumber.name: avclDeviceVolumesRaidGrpNumber
avclDeviceVolumesRaidGrpNumber.description: Shows the raid group number to which the volume belongs. e.g. 'LU 1: 2; LU 2: 2; LU 3: 1;......'

avclDeviceVolumesRaidLevel.name: avclDeviceVolumesRaidLevel
avclDeviceVolumesRaidLevel.description: Shows the raid level the volume is configured. Can be any of the following: 0 - RAID 0 1 - RAID 1 5 - RAID 5 e.g. 'LU 1: 0; LU 2: 0; LU 3: 5;......'

avclDeviceVolumesSize.name: avclDeviceVolumesSize
avclDeviceVolumesSize.description: Shows the size of all volumes in the device, in units of KB. e.g. 'LU 1: 1,500,000; LU 2: 7,000,000; LU 3: 15,000,000;......'

avclDeviceVolumesInitProgress.name: avclDeviceVolumesInitProgress
avclDeviceVolumesInitProgress.description: Contains the progress, in percentage, of the initialization or reconstruction for all volumes undergoing such process. e.g. 'LU 1: 1; LU 2: 89; LU 3: 64;......'

avclDeviceVolumesNickname.name: avclDeviceVolumesNickname
avclDeviceVolumesNickname.description: Contains the nickname or mount point of each volume in a device. If no nickname, the value is the zero-length string. e.g. 'LU 1: /mnt/device/sda; LU 2: ; LU 3: /mnt/device/sdc;......'

avclDeviceDriveCount.name: avclDeviceDriveCount
avclDeviceDriveCount.description: The count of all drives present in any device. Maximum number of drives is 15, but can be 30 if there is an expansion. eg. 15

avclDeviceDrivesState.name: avclDeviceDrivesState
avclDeviceDrivesState.description: Contains the state of the drives present in the device. Can be one of the following: - On Line - Off Line - Spare - Not Configured - Working Properly - Failed or Not Attached - Under Reconstruction - Under Retry - Installed - Not Installed - Starting Up - Standing By - Power Supplied to the Drive - No Power Supplied - Drive is Reserved - Drive is Not Reserved e.g. 'Drive 1: Spare; LU 2: Starting UP; ......'

avclDeviceDrivesUsageType.name: avclDeviceDrivesUsageType
avclDeviceDrivesUsageType.description: The usage type of the drive in the device. Can be one of the ff.: - In Array - Not Assigned - As Spare - HDD does not exist e.g. 'Drive 1: As Spare; Drive 2: Not Assigned; ......'

avclDeviceDrivesRaidGrpOrSpareNumber.name: avclDeviceDrivesRaidGrpOrSpareNumber
avclDeviceDrivesRaidGrpOrSpareNumber.description: The raid group or spare number this drive belongs. If this is 'Not Assigned' or 'HDD does not exist', the value is the zero-length string. e.g. 'Drive 1: Spare 2; Drive 2: Array 1; ......'

avclDeviceComponentCount.name: avclDeviceComponentCount
avclDeviceComponentCount.description: The count of all components present in any device. eg. 3

avclDeviceComponentsType.name: avclDeviceComponentsType
avclDeviceComponentsType.description: The usage type of the component in the device. Can be one of the ff.: - Power Supply - Fan e.g. 'Component 1: Power Supply; Component 2: Fan; ......'

avclDeviceComponentsState.name: avclDeviceComponentsState
avclDeviceComponentsState.description: Contains the state of the components present in the device. Can be one of the following: - Normal - Fail - Not Available e.g. 'Component 1: Normal; Component 2: Fail; ......'

avclDeviceComponentsInstanceNumber.name: avclDeviceComponentsInstanceNumber
avclDeviceComponentsInstanceNumber.description: The index number of each unique component device type. Format of values are: PS1 - Power Supply 1 F2 - Fan 2 e.g. 'Component 1: PS1; Component 2: F2; ......'

avclEvents.name: avclEvents
avclEvents.description: The events for AVC-L as detected by the daemon.

daemonEvent.name: daemonEvent
daemonEvent.description: This trap is sent if SNMP notification is enabled for any or all of the critical (needs troubleshooting) events described at 'avclEventInfo' above. There are other events but are categorized as status-changed events that don't need troubleshooting, just for informational purposes.
